reviewText: This season was hilarious, infact, the WHOLE series is... so please dont let my 2 star rating fool you. The show itself is 5+ stars!  It is simply about the quality of the dvd.  The 1st 3 seasons were all on 3 dvds or less per season, and the fourth did have four dvds as well.  BUT ALL FOUR of them were all much better quality than the 5th season.  Most of it is viewable, in fact it all is.  HOWEVER, there are several scenes within episodes (typically the first 2 and last 2 episodes of the dvd) are very, well, blotchy like... sort of like watching a poor quality youtube video online. But it is mainly when there is alot of movement with in the scene between the actors.  NO, IT IS NOT MY TV or DVD PLAYER.  NO, IT IS NOT THAT IM USE TO BLUE RAY.  Unless my box set is just a bad lemon, I do feel as if this set isn't top quality for regular dvd.And to the haters that are going to say this isn't a helpful review, bite me, k?  B/c it is helpful, at least informative if nothing else. You're just upset that I didn't rate the show higher.  Like I said, the show itself is wonderful, including this season.  I'm simply writing a review of the product's quality, not just the actual show.The truth is, I'm just glad that they are finally releasing the rest of the series.  It just seems to me that if fans were able to wait over 3 years for season 4 to be realeased (yea, season 3 was released in 2007 & season 4 was in 2010) then I say we can wait an extra couple of weeks for them to properly inspect the quality of their product.  If you have a superior show, why not have superior quality?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Helen Hunt and Paul Reiser give us a real look at marriage 20th century style.  Take the incredible timing of all the actors, add superb writing and directing, and the result is a laugh-out-loud (even when I'm by myself) over the top sitcom of relationship foes,woes and woos.  And the family, don't even get me started.  No weak links in this sitcom.  I've watched this almost as many times as Mary Tyler Moore or Bob Newhart. Don't miss this series if you like to laugh at yourself.

reviewText: Mad About You is one of the funniest shows of the 90's and the fifth season was one of their best. I want to say that this set is worth the price because it is a show unlike any other.  I am very satisfied with this purchase. It is a good show for people that love to laugh at everyday occurrences or that are nostalgic for the simplicity of a 90's sitcom.  Helen Hunt especially steals the show as Jamie, the wife on the series.

reviewText: I loved this comedy in the time of its original heyday, and I now enjoy so much, the comedy of each of the characters on this show. "Mad About You" is one of those shows where you wish that all the characters were someone in your family, or living in your neighborhood, or working with you - they are so real, funny and relatable. Even Murray the dog is a funny character - you just want to love him to pieces!  Each episode of this season are great, culminating of course with Paul and Jamie having the baby. "Mad About You" is comedy at its best, the kind of comedy that somehow can't be found too much these days. I enjoy watching each season as it comes out, tremendously. My only complaint and regret is that it takes so very long for the seasons to come out!  I don't know why that is, but please, put a rush on the next seasons because this is such a great show and should be available for purchase to the many people who I'm sure want to watch.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Okay, the praises are a bit over stated... or are they? The fact of the matter is, this is one of the best series ever produced. Why?First, intelligent dialogue that might actually happen. Consistent throughout series!Second, wonderfully cast roles. Seriously. The casting director deserves an Emmy.Third, generous attention to details. Nuanced performances.Fourth, actually filmed in NY, unlike that 'other' series - you know the one.Fifth, a whole series story arc. Many shows get bogged down in same ol' same ol'Sixth, growth in characters. How often is this aspect not included? Too often!Seventh, you care about these people, truly care. How rare is that?Expecting the release of the final two seasons by what? 2013 maybe? We hope. And then the Blu Ray will inevitably come.There was criticism in Season 5's video. I didn't experience the blotchy thing they spoke of (which happens on digital with fast actions, quick motions). I would notice, too, since I am a photographer and artist.The 'extras' were, as has been the case with this series, skimpy. But I don't really need commentaries and interviews (a few are included throughout). Sometimes a show can just stand on its own without comment. This one does. It's all there, if you're paying attention.

reviewText: Season 5 brings us the Buchmans' anticipation of their soon-to-be first child -- and of course, all the mix-ups, drama and hilarity that accompanies their journey. Paul and Jamie deal with their own clashing ideas and opinions, their friends and family. Jamie must find the balance between motherhood and career, as well as the Buchmans' beloved dog Murray.Guest stars include Carol Burnett as Jamie's mother and Mel Brooks as Paul's uncle -- both eccentric in their own way, as essentially all the extended family members are.Viewers are in for lots of laughs as they await Baby Buchman along with Paul and Jamie.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Loved this show when it was on the air, and was glad a year or two ago to see DVDs for some of the seasons, and like many people, was frustrated when it seemed like we'd never get 5, 6, or 7.I was very happy when season 5 came out, since in my opinion season 4 was the worst of them all (but still decent).  I hated that my collection ended with that low point in the series life.  Season 5 is where it started getting good again.Quality is good, no problems with sound or video anywhere on any of the discs.  I have captures of seasons 6 and 7 but not great quality, so now I'm just waiting for the next DVD's to some out.  At least there's word that it won't be as long between now!
summary: Always one of my favorite series

reviewText: After season 4 spends so much time rife with angst, season 5 comes back with renewed vigor. The characters and plotlines progress and more than just giggling at their antics, the audience gets to see another side of married life. There are a few very memorable episodes, and overall this season is upbeat, with a dose of funny reality. Enjoy!

reviewText: Me and my ma argue lots about which season is the best and neither one of us can't never make up our minds. So I am just gonna say season 5 and be done with it. it tended to feature more Paul Reiser than Helen Hunt 'cause Helen Hunt thought she was going to be a big movie star cause the likes a such films as Twister and As Good As it Gets.Unfortunately Ms. Helen Hunt shoulda paid attention to the name a that last film because now she basically does direct to video fare that usually ain't no good. I did hear some things in the Star about her not being very nice on the set and my cousin Virgil insists that he saw her swear at a waitress at the Hard Rock Cafe in Indianapolis. Virgil's a bit full of the baloney sometimes though and he don't like to get to cleaned up and he don;t go into the city but once a year when his boss gets him those free tickets to a Colts preseason game.I didn't find Helen Hunt very attractive much, but I don't think she really is into men that much what with having to manage her direct to video acting career.

reviewText: Sony released the first three seasons.  Season 3 was released nearly four years after the release of Season 2.  On February 22, 2010, Shout! Factory acquired the rights to release the remaining seasons. They released the fourth season on June 29, 2010.  Instead of waiting four years, they're releasing Season 5 on November 2, 2010.For those of us who have waited years and years for this to happen, thank you!  Sony really missed out.  As another reviewer said, every piece of rubbish from 40 - 50 years ago has been released, but an award-winning series with an Oscar-winning actress was shelved.Please, Shout! Factory, release Seasons 6 and 7!  Thank you!
summary: Thank God that Shout! Factory acquired the rights!!!

reviewText: This was an enjoyable sitcom from the 1990's starring Helen Hunt and Paul Reiser. Most of the shows are very funny, some hilarious, some will touch your heart. The last two seasons of Mad About You have not been released yet. I'd say its about time. If this was a favorite show then I suggest you add it to your DVD collection. The character of  Ira Buchman is played by John Pankow, who is the younger brother of James  Pankow, trombonist with the popular rock group Chicago. Some of the funniest scenes are between Ira and Paul. Leila Kenzle plays Fran, Jamie's friend. Richard Kind plays Fran's husband and he has som hilarious scenes. Many of my favorite shows center around their dog Murray. There is one Thanksgiving episode called Giblets for Murray that is superb. The string of guests that appear is also great. Billy Joel, Sid Caesar, Mel Brooks, Lyle Lovett. Look the series up on th imdb and you can see all the shows and guests. Please release seasons six and seven !!!!!!!!!!One word about the quality. The first season comes in a plastic box with all 24 episodes on 2 discs. The quality is not that great. I believe the rest of the season 2-5 are all on 4 disc packages. There is a cardboard sleeve over the disc box which is very difficult to get off. My season 2 ripped. Season 1 needs to be redone for better quality. Such classic shows on season 1 such as when Paul and Jamie first met.Trivia question. Where have you seen Jamie's obstetrician  ? Hint ... On Star Trek, but what character
summary: A Memorable Series With Some Very Funny Writing
